Description: Fragment of body of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis. Inside glazed. Outside, two animal friezes separated by a single line: above, two felines, back-to-back (their hindquarters remain); unincised rosette as filling ornament; below, bird to right, part of the wing preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 82 no. 276 pl. 62)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2086)
